channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mamdani lands endorsement of a top Cuomo backer in NYC mayoral primary
item.description: Rep. Adriano Espaillat endorses Zohran Mamdani for NYC mayor in a setback for Andrew Cuomo, who previously received the influential congressman's supp...

item.title: My Day in Jersey
item.description: There’s great art in the Garden State’s Montclair Art Museum.

item.title: Magistrate: Trial Should Go On For WI Judge Accused Of Helping Illegal Alien Flee
item.description: U.S. Magistrate Nancy Joseph found Judge Hannah Dugan’s arguments to dismiss her federal criminal case 'unconvincing.'

item.title: One Big, Beautiful, and Historic Welfare Reform
item.description: There’s more to be done. But the recently passed mega-bill is the largest welfare reform in human history.

item.title: This SCOTUS Session Confirmed The Vibe Shift On Transing Kids
item.description: The gender craze is losing in the Supreme Court and in the court of public opinion.

item.title: Here’s What’s Next In The Battle To Get Federal Spending Under Control
item.description: Congress should do its job and keep restricting the growth of exploding federal spending.

item.title: Brennan says he's 'clueless' about why FBI authorities want to investigate him
item.description: Former CIA Director John Brennan said Wednesday that he is "clueless" about what the Justice Department and FBI authorities could be investigating.

item.title: The Gen Z glossary for Gen X managers: Here’s what your workers mean by ‘menty B’ and ‘cozzie livs’
item.description: It won’t be long until Gen X managers feel left out of watercooler chats with their twentysomething-year-old workers.

item.title: Trump Has No Reason To Compromise With Democrats On Immigration
item.description: Inviting Democrats to sit at the immigration-policy table will accomplish nothing and will jeopardize this core issue of the president’s.

item.title: CEOs reacting to tariffs with wait-and-see have a dangerous misread of the moment
item.description: Tariffs aren’t the cause of disruption. They’re the accelerant—and companies risk falling behind.

item.title: Hawley moves to block China's buy-up of US farmland as Trump admin sounds alarm
item.description: Sen. Hawley's bill aims to counter Chinese ownership of U.S. farmland, especially near military bases, which officials call a security concern.

item.title: Why It’s Smart to Raise Taxes on Private-School Endowments
item.description: Progressive higher-ed behemoths will survive just fine without preferential tax rates.

item.title: Terrorist Attack In Texas Demands Federal Targeting Of Antifa
item.description: While local law enforcement understands the threat, little work has been done at the federal level to confront Antifa.

item.title: It’s a cruel summer for student loan borrowers. Here’s how business leaders can make the case for better benefits for their employees
item.description: As the Trump administration allows garnishing wages of borrowers in default, experts say student loan benefits are a business imperative.

item.title: The S&P is soaring, but fewer companies are setting record highs. Why that could be a red flag for the market
item.description: Pay attention to market breadth, analysts say.

item.title: Federal judge blocks Trump's birthright citizenship ban for all infants, testing lower court powers
item.description: The judge granted class certification to all infants in the U.S. impacted by the executive order.

item.title: Linda Yaccarino brought some advertisers back to X—but the real power was always with owner Elon Musk
item.description: The former NBCUniversal exec is leaving after two years, following Musk's sale of X to his own company xAI.

item.title: Alienating South Korea and Japan Is a Strategic Blunder
item.description: High tariffs on the two nations will drive a wedge between America and its strongest allies in the Indo-Pacific region.

item.title: Mind the Inflation Gap: Hedging with Real Assets
item.description: Timely insights on portfolio risk, inflation hedging, and market cycles—grounded in financial history and written for investment decision-makers.

item.title: Book Review: Cheaper Faster Better: How We’ll Win the Climate War
item.description: Can capitalism save the planet? Tom Steyer makes the case in this urgent, optimistic roadmap to a net-zero future.

item.title: Buyers Beware: 7 Red Flags That Signal a Private Market Reckoning
